channel.title: Link server accounts?
channel.description: Does anyone know how to link a rsps with forums so if they make forums account they can use that for forums. Basically Linking PHP servers or something to do with Curl. If anyone has a script/tutorial for this post below please :D thanks in advance.

item.title: Link server accounts?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

DignityOnline:

Soo much discussion on my thread

I actually found a way to login just using the SMF database and the Java server.
When the player logs have the server sha1 the password (there are some methods released online for exactly this) and the send a connection to the database requesting the username and password. The server itself has return codes for each different type of failure you could get when trying to connect to the database.
But, I’m sure there’s a better way to do it than what I said.

Read full topic

item.title: Link server accounts?
item.dc:creator: @DignityOnline DignityOnline
item.description:

item.title: Link server accounts?
item.dc:creator: @gunz4life gunz4life
item.description:
@gunz4life wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:18, topic:544305”][quote author=gunz4life link=topic=663185.msg4432696#msg4432696 date=1403983126]

Better off having the server query the SMF database for user credentials

SMF uses encryption.

And that is a problem why?

Lets send a raw password that hasn’t been encrypted to match SMF’s encryption to check if it’s a valid password.

The PHP script would end up pulling the salt for the account that is being logged into, and hash the password with it to see if the password entered matches the password stored in the database, therefore it’ll work perfectly and wont be problematic lol
[/quote]
Except for we were talking about not using PHP and sending it directly from the Java Server to the MySQL database.[/quote]

Oh, wasn’t paying attention too much to previous comments, thought you guys were talking about writing a PHP script for verification as I saw someone made a comment about PHP and password checking within the first few comments.

Nonetheless, it would be the same process regardless, the server would still take the password and salt for the account that the person is attempting to login too, hash the password the person has entered and match it up with the one in DB to see if they match.

Read full topic

item.title: Link server accounts?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Ambokile:

When I’ve linked up Grand Theft Auto servers with forums in the past, I’ve had the forum set up with a database on the forum server, and then a game server set up with a database on the game server. I’d then have a simple script which I could query with something like checkpassword.php?username=Ambokile&password=pass, which would then use the forum’s encryption method to return 1 or 0 depending on whether or not they gave the correct credentials. The player’s game statistics would be on the game server but their login information would be on the forum server. This is another approach for when you need to be sparing with your external connections.

^Something like this. I’ve got my RSPS integrated with my SMF forums. I can assign smf ranks via the server and all that. Meaning if you’re banned on the server, you’re banned in the forums.

Read full topic

item.title: Link server accounts?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

When I’ve linked up Grand Theft Auto servers with forums in the past, I’ve had the forum set up with a database on the forum server, and then a game server set up with a database on the game server. I’d then have a simple script which I could query with something like checkpassword.php?username=Ambokile&password=pass, which would then use the forum’s encryption method to return 1 or 0 depending on whether or not they gave the correct credentials. The player’s game statistics would be on the game server but their login information would be on the forum server. This is another approach for when you need to be sparing with your external connections.

Read full topic

item.title: Link server accounts?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

I’ve seen servers in the past do something like this. Much like Pwnd said, you could have some sort of automated registration script which contained the variables for username and password, and then executed. But you’d have to catch exceptions that say the username is already in use, or anything else that would impede registration, send it to the server (RSPS), then generate a code to send to the client that will display to the user the issue.

Read full topic

item.title: Link server accounts?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Do you mean to share passwords between client and forum? And then to also get whatever associated data from the RSPS server to the forums?

Depends on the forum software, but if you are forcing them to create their accounts for the server on the forums, see how the authentication works in the forum source and port it over to your server. Or you could just write a simple script and have the server query that script and return a response. You’d have to secure that response, however, or people could just spoof a correct response.

Read full topic
